newsitem.title: USA: USWC CARB gasoline rises with NYMEX, tight supply.
newsitem.headline: USWC CARB gasoline rises with NYMEX, tight supply.

text.p: U.S. West Coast CARB gasoline rose amid tight supplies and higher NYMEX markets Friday, brokers said.

West Coast gasoline remains tight, traders said, down 587,000 barrels as of February 28 with half-a-dozen of the region's refiners entering or still in maintenance, costing refiners about 300,000 bpd in throughput.

But traders said plants taken off line in January could begin start-up this coming week, including the crude unit at Mobil's 130,000 bpd crude Torrance, Calif., refinery and several unit's at Exxon's plant near San Francisco.

Meanwhile, heating oil for April delivery ended 0.65 cents a gallon higher on Friday, hitting 54.08 cents lifted by technical strength and forecasts of below-normal temperatures in the high-consumption Northeast U.S.
Front-month gasoline soe 1.19 cents to 65.67 cents.
Traders saw spot trade activity rising Monday and Tuesday ahead of pipeline commitment deadlines for third cycle March gasoline.
CARB gasoline in Los Angeles rose one cent to 76/77 cents a gallon, while San Francisco material climbed to 73/74 cents, narrowing the normal 2.50-cent spread between the two cities.
CARB diesel in L.A. was heard done at 74 cents, and the range was talked 72.50/74 cents, flat from yesterday.
